DOC.brief_summary: This study will answer the question whether there is a difference in the effects and complication rates of ultrasound guided continuous interscalene block (CISB) and nerve stimulation-guided continuous cervical paravertebral block (CCPVB). The aim of this study is to evaluate the differences in efficacy and side effects - if any.
DOC.brief_title: Continuous Blockade of the Brachial Plexus
DOC.detailed_description: This is a prospective randomized double-blinded study that will compare two commonly used approaches for the continuous blockade of the brachial plexus: the CCPVB, which focusses on the six cervical nerve root (C6 root), and CISB, which focuses on the upper trunk of the brachial plexus. Data of sensory testing, motor strength, shoulder pain, phrenic nerve function, recurrent laryngeal nerve (RNL) function, ipsilateral Horner's syndrome, block time and medication doses used for block placement, will be collected. All observations and measurements will be made by a member of the research team who is unaware of patient allocation to any particular group.
DOC.criteria: between the ages of 18 and 80 years have an American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) Health Classification of I, II, or III scheduled for shoulder arthroplasty or rotator cuff repair surgery patients with a BMI of =to/< 40 contraindications to any of the two blocks or allergy to any of the drugs used history of shoulder surgery that developed into any other surgery other than total shoulder arthroplasty or rotator cuff repair history of previous experiences with any of the two blocks history of chronic opioid therapy for longer than the past 6 months patients with a BMI >40
